title: Calories in a Bourbon Shot
meta_description: Discover calories in bourbon shot, including full nutrition breakdown per standard pour, alcohol content, and tips for variations under 160 characters.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) shot of bourbon whiskey, 80 proof (40% ABV), straight with no mixers or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, pour size, and any additions; values are approximate. Drink responsibly and check labels.

quick_answer.text: A standard shot of bourbon provides about 97 calories, primarily from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: On the rocks (melted ice dilution, no calorie change)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of bourbon?
faqs.a: Approximately 97 calories for a standard 1.5 oz shot at 80 proof.

faqs.q: Does bourbon have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Straight bourbon has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: What affects calories in bourbon shots?
faqs.a: Proof strength, pour size, and mixers; higher proof or additions increase calories.
Yes, a pure shot has 0 g carbs, making it keto-friendly in moderation.

faqs.q: How many shots equal a standard drink?
faqs.a: One 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof bourbon is one standard drink.
